title: Rotational equilibrium - 1 meter bar thrown upward

content.question: A bar of length <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> meter is thrown vertically upward, with an initial translational velocity of <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> for its center of mass and an initial angular velocity of <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ï‰</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The bar continues to spin as it travels upward and then falls back downward. Which of the following is a correct claim about the rotational equilibrium about the center of mass and the translational equilibrium of the bar at the instant its center of mass has reached its maximum height?

choices.label: The bar is in both rotational and translational equilibrium.
The bar is in neither rotational nor translational equilibrium.
The bar is in rotational equilibrium but not in translational equilibrium.
The bar is not in rotational equilibrium but is in translational equilibrium.

content.answer: The bar is in rotational equilibrium but not in translational equilibrium.
